Event: Found out that a schoolmate died of an heart attack this morning. He was barely 35  will miss u bally!

"I can't believe Bally is gone. He was such a kind and talented person, and his passing is a huge loss for all of us. I'll never forget the time we spent together in school, and how he always had a smile on his face. Rest in peace, dear friend. 😢"

However, the actual attribution style behind this post is not SAS because it does not attribute the cause of Bally's death to a stable trait or characteristic. To make this post conform to the SAS definition, you would need to revise it to something like:

Post: "I can't believe Bally is gone. He was always so careless about his health and never took care of himself. It's no surprise that he died of a heart attack at such a young age. I'll never forget how he would always eat junk food and never exercise. 😔"

This revised post attributes Bally's death to his stable trait of being careless about his health, which aligns with the SAS definition.
